comment.author: 35832612@N04
comment._content: Simply stunning with very good details and depth. Top drawer shot and worthy museum piece.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: AT LAST I FOUND IT! Over a year of puzzling it out. Not easy when you have never been there and you are 400 kms away. But thanks to Google maps, satellite photos, and Google Street view, I can say that it is ... BALLAST POINT, Birchgrove, looking north-west to Snail's Bay. Most of the houses on the left are still standing, and a trip along Wharf Street using Google Street View will confirm roof lines, chimneys, etc match this photo. Btw Powerhouse Museum Collection, the houses are definitely NOT "Federation style"; late Victorian Italianate (and some earlier) is more like it. Where the three gents are sitting, Ballast Point, shows up as a deserted Texaco / Caltex site on the satellite picture. Just last year (11/7/2009) it was again declared a public park. Pity this photo was not identified for that. I imagine the rock the gents are on has long been quarried away, but a field trip and now photo would be terrific. Anyone nearby? Ballast Point history - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballast_Point,_New_South_Wales Google Maps satellite view - maps.google.com.au/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&...
